fr.sii.ogham.email.sendgrid.builder

Class AbstractSendGridBuilder<MYSELF extends AbstractSendGridBuilder<MYSELF,EmailBuilder>,EmailBuilder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<EmailBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.email.sendgrid.builder.AbstractSendGridBuilder<MYSELF,EmailBuilder>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<SendGridSender>, Parent<EmailBuilder>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SendGridV2Builder, SendGridV4Builder

extends AbstractParent<EmailBuilder>
implements Builder<SendGridSender>

    • Method Detail

      • apiKey

        public MYSELF apiKey(String apiKey)
        Set SendGrid API key.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using apiKey(). 

         .apiKey("my-key")
 .apiKey()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-key")
 
         .apiKey("my-key")
 .apiKey()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-key")
        In both cases, apiKey("my-key") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        apiKey - the API key to use
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • apiKey

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<MYSELF,String> apiKey()
        Set SendGrid API key.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .apiKey()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-key")

        Non-null value set using apiKey(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .apiKey("my-key")
 .apiKey()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-key")
        The value "my-key" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • username

        public abstract MYSELF username(String username)
        Set username for SendGrid HTTP API.

        WARNING: SendGrid v4 doesn't use username/password anymore. You must use an apiKey(String).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using username(). 

         .username("my-username")
 .username()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-username")
 
         .username("my-username")
 .username()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-username")
        In both cases, username("my-username") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        username - the user name for SendGrid HTTP API
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • username

        public abstract ConfigurationValueBuilder<MYSELF,String> username()
        Set username for SendGrid HTTP API.

        WARNING: SendGrid v4 doesn't use username/password anymore. You must use an apiKey(String).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .username()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-username")

        Non-null value set using username(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .username("my-username")
 .username()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-username")
        The value "my-username" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

      • password

        public abstract MYSELF password(String password)
        Set password for SendGrid HTTP API.

        WARNING: SendGrid v4 doesn't use username/password anymore. You must use an apiKey(String).

 .password()

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

      • url

        public MYSELF url(URL url)
        Set SendGrid API base URL.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using url(). 

         .url("http://localhost/sendgrid")
 .url()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("http://api.sendgrid.com")
 
         .url("http://localhost/sendgrid")
 .url()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("http://api.sendgrid.com")
        In both cases, url("http://localhost/sendgrid") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        url - the base URL for SendGrid HTTP API
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • url

 .url()

        Parameters:
        url - the base URL for SendGrid HTTP API
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if URL is malformed

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<MYSELF,URL> url()

      • httpClient

        public MYSELF httpClient(org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient httpClient)
        By default, calling SendGrid HTTP API is done through the default SendGrid implementation that uses default HttpClient (calling HttpClientBuilder.create().build()). If you want to use another HTTP client implementation, you can extend the CloseableHttpClient class and provide it: 
         .client(new MyCustomHttpClient())
        Parameters:
        httpClient - the custom implementation of HttpClient used to call SendGrid HTTP API. SendGrid requires a CloseableHttpClient.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • mimetype

        public MimetypeDetectionBuilder<MYSELF> mimetype()
        Builder that configures mimetype detection. There exists several implementations to provide the mimetype:
        • Using Java MimetypesFileTypeMap
        • Using Java 7 Files.probeContentType(java.nio.file.Path)
        • Using Apache Tika
        • Using JMimeMagic

        Both implementations provided by Java are based on file extensions. This can't be used in most cases as we often handle InputStreams.

        In previous version of Ogham, JMimeMagic was used and was working quite well. Unfortunately, the library is no more maintained.

        You can configure how Tika will detect mimetype: 

         .mimetype()
    .tika()
       ...

        This builder allows to use several providers. It will chain them until one can find a valid mimetype. If none is found, you can explicitly provide the default one: 

         .mimetype()
    .defaultMimetype("text/html")

        If no mimetype detector was previously defined, it creates a new one. Then each time you call mimetype(), the same instance is used.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure mimetype detection

      • mimetype

        public MYSELF mimetype(MimetypeDetectionBuilder<?> builder)
        NOTE: this is mostly for advance usage (when creating a custom module). Inherits mimetype configuration from another builder. This is useful for configuring independently different parts of Ogham but keeping a whole coherence. The same instance is shared meaning that all changes done here will also impact the other builder.

        If a previous builder was defined (by calling mimetype() for example), the new builder will override it.

        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to inherit
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
